title.rendered: Get Sinusitis Treatment By ENT Specialist In West Delhi

content.rendered:
The joint inflammation of the paranasal sinuses, which are the air cavities within the passage of the nose is what we call sinusitis. The sinuses are interlinked arrangement in the skull. These cavities need to work efficiently because they are responsible for the smooth passage of mucus. Sinusitis can be of two types: acute sinusitis or chronic sinusitis. Several reasons are responsible for the cause of this disease. This includes bacterias, fungi, allergies or due to an autoimmune reason. Although sinusitis is a widespread problem, you should at least consult with an ENT specialist in West Delhi. It is not a contagious disease.

Acute sinusitis

It is the inflammation of the nasal pages that lasts for a short period. The most common reason is bacteria, viruses, fungi, allergies, nasal polyps, a deviation in the nasal septum, cystic fibrosis.

The symptoms of acute sinusitis are nasal congestion, earache, toothache, fever, fatigue, foul breath, cough, breathing problem (sometimes), pain on and behind your eyes, forehead, cheeks, etc.

Acute sinusitis is the most common form of sinusitis. It does not need elaborate treatment. A lot of times, it will self heal without any medical intervention. But, it is better if you see the doctor once as well as get some medicines for the same.

Chronic Sinusitis

Chronic sinusitis lasts for a long time, and it does not usually occur due to bacteria or viruses.  Also, this form of sinusitis requires a long term in-depth treatment. The treatment of chronic sinusitis depends on the prime cause.

The symptoms of chronic sinusitis are nose blockage, redness, swelling, irritation of the nasal passages, thick discharge, pain, swelling and redness around the eyes, ear pain, jaw pain, sore throat, etc.

Chronic sinusitis also cannot self-heal, and it requires proper diagnosis and treatment. You should see a doctor immediately if you experience fever, stiff neck, severe headache, puffiness around your face and eyes, etc.

Also, people who are most vulnerable to chronic sinusitis are those who have asthma, nasal polyps, sensitive to aspirin, dental problems, HIV/Aids, etc.

If you don’t treat sinusitis in time, then it may give rise to several complications like vision problems, infections, thrombosis, infection of the bones, meningitis, seizure, etc.

Prevention is always better than cure. If you doubt that you have the symptoms of sinusitis then you must treat it immediately. Visit organ Hospital in West Delhi for the best, advanced treatments within an affordable price range.
